question: Pretibial myxedema is a feature of which of the following?

answers.option: Focal abnormality in pigment production by a discrete field of melanocytes

A 45-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of lower back pain for 3 months. The pain is radiating to the right leg with numbness up to his foot. Pain is continuous, and bowel and bladder functions are intact. He has a history of hypertension for the past 14 years. On examination, the right straight leg raise test is 60 degrees, and the left is 90 degrees. Sciatic nerve stretch is negative, right piriformis test is positive, and Faber test is negative. Reflexes and myotomes are intact with dermatomes, and the heel and toe walk test are normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-year-old boy presented with the complaint of bending of his trunk as noticed by his parents for 2 years. On radiological evaluation, a thoracolumbar curve was found out to be 11 degrees. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option for this patient?

answers.option: Orthotic intervention of curve progress to > 1 degree during interval follow up
Plan surgery if curve progress to > 20 degrees before skeletal maturity
Clinical and radiographic followup every 1-2 years till skeletal maturity

question: A 5-year-old boy presented with generalized itching all over the body. On examination, there were excoriated papules over genitals, fingers, and toe web. Which of these is the most likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old male with diabetes presents with recent right below-knee amputation secondary to infection in the foot. Which of these most important muscles should be strengthened to prepare for prosthetic ambulation?

answers.option: Hip flexors, hip extensor and hip adductors
Hip extensor, hip flexors, knee flexor
Hip extensor, knee extensor and hip abductors
Hip abductors and adductors and knee flexors
Hip flexors, knee extensors knee flexor

question: A middle-aged female presents with acne, obesity, hirsutism, irregular menses. Which investigation will help in the diagnosis?

She describes that initially, there were small bullae with necrotic dry adherent crust and underlying ulceration which slowly with scarring. There is no history of travel. answers.option: Infiltration of epidermis by inflammatory cells
Thickening and separation of stratum corneum
Loss of intercellular cohesion between dermal cells
Loss of intercellular cohesion between keratinocytes
